snippet: Marvin Williams, who was picked ahead of Chris Paul and Deron Williams, has become an important contributor for Atlanta.
abstract: Marvin Williams, who was picked ahead of Chris Paul and Deron Williams, has become an important contributor for Atlanta.
lead_paragraph: Seven years ago, a bad decision by then Hawks general manager Billy Knight consigned Marvin Williams to a career of unfair comparisons. Despite the fact that Williams had only played one unremarkable year of college ball, Knight passed on the highly touted Deron Williams and Chris Paul to make Williams, a sixth man and combo forward out of North Carolina, the No. 2 overall pick in the 2005 draft.

headline.main: For the Hawks, It's a Marvin Williams Moment
